Title: The Godfather
Descriptiton: The aging patriarch of an organized crime dynasty in postwar New York City transfers control of his clandestine empire to his reluctant youngest son.

Genre.Name: Crime
Genre.Description: Crime films, in the broadest sense, are a cinematic genre inspired by and analogous to the crime fiction literary genre.

Director.Name: Francis Ford Coppola
Director.Bio: Francis Ford Coppola is an American film director, producer, and screenwriter.

Description: The aging patriarch of an organized crime dynasty in postwar New York City transfers control of his empire to his reluctant youngest son.

Title: The Shawshank Redemption
Description: Over the course of several years, two convicts form a friendship, seeking consolation and, eventually, redemption through basic compassion.

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: In film and television, drama is a category or genre of narrative fiction (or semi-fiction) intended to be more serious than humorous in tone.

Director.Name: Frank Darabont
Director.Bio: Frank Árpád Darabont is a French-born American film director, screenwriter and producer.

Title: Schindler's List
Description: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, industrialist Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.

Genere.Name: History
Genere.Description: A historical film is a fiction film showing past events or set within a historical period.

Director.Name: Steven Spielberg
Director.Bio: Steven Allan Spielberg KBE is an American filmmaker.

Title: Raging Bull
Description: The life of boxer Jake LaMotta, whose violence and temper that led him to the top in the ring destroyed his life outside of it.

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: In film and television, drama is a category or genre of narrative fiction (or semi-fiction) intended to be more serious than humorous in tone.

Director.Name: Martin Scorsese
Director.Bio: Martin Charles Scorsese is an American film director, producer, screenwriter and actor.

Title: Casablanca
Description: A cynical expatriate American cafe owner struggles to decide whether or not to help his former lover and her fugitive husband escape the Nazis in French Morocco.

Genre.Name: Romance
Genre.Description: Romance films or movies involve romantic love stories recorded in visual media for broadcast in theatres or on television that focus on passion, emotion, and the affectionate romantic involvement of the main characters.

Director.Name: Michael Curtiz
Director.Bio: Michael Curtiz was a Hungarian-American film director, recognized as one of the most prolific directors in history.

Title: Citizen Kane
Description: Following the death of publishing tycoon Charles Foster Kane, reporters scramble to uncover the meaning of his final utterance: 'Rosebud.'

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: In film and television, drama is a category or genre of narrative fiction (or semi-fiction) intended to be more serious than humorous in tone.

Director.Name: Orson Welles
Director.Bio: George Orson Welles was an American actor, director, producer, and screenwriter who is remembered for his innovative work in film, radio, and theatre.

Title: Gone with the Wind
Description: American motion picture classic in which a manipulative woman and a roguish man conduct a turbulent romance during the Civil War and Reconstruction periods.

Genre.Name: Romance
Genre.Description: Romance films or movies involve romantic love stories recorded in visual media for broadcast in theatres or on television that focus on passion, emotion, and the affectionate romantic involvement of the main characters.

Director.Name: Victor Fleming
Director.Bio: Victor Lonzo Fleming was an iconic American film director, cinematographer, and producer.

Title: The Wizard of Oz
Description: Young Dorothy Gale and her dog Toto are swept away by a tornado from their Kansas farm to the magical Land of Oz, and embark on a quest with three new friends to see the Wizard, who can return her to her home and fulfill the others' wishes.

Genre.Name: Adventure
Genre.Description: Adventure films are a genre of film that typically use their action scenes to display and explore exotic locations in an energetic way.

Director.Name: Victor Fleming
Director.Bio: Victor Lonzo Fleming was an iconic American film director, cinematographer, and producer.

Title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
Description: In the Fall of 1963, a Korean War veteran and criminal pleads insanity and is admitted to a mental institution, where he rallies up the scared patients against the tyrannical nurse.

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: In film and television, drama is a category or genre of narrative fiction (or semi-fiction) intended to be more serious than humorous in tone.

Director.Name: Milos Forman
Director.Bio: Jan Tomáš "Miloš" Forman was a Czech-American film director, screenwriter, actor, and professor.

Title: Lawrence of Arabia
Description: The story of T.E. Lawrence, the English officer who successfully united and led the diverse, often warring, Arab tribes during World War I in order to fight the Turks.

Genre.Name: Adventure
Genre.Description: Adventure films are a genre of film that typically use their action scenes to display and explore exotic locations in an energetic way.

Director.Name: David Lean
Director.Bio: Sir David Lean CBE was an English film director, producer, screenwriter and editor.
